title: Fact Check-Image of a destroyed bridge was not taken in May 2022 ...
htmlTitle: Fact Check-Image of a destroyed bridge was not taken in May 2022 ...
snippet: May 2, 2022 ... VERDICT. Miscaptioned. An image of a damaged railway bridge collapsed into a body of water was not taken in 2022 during the Russia-Ukraine war.
htmlSnippet: May 2, 2022 ... VERDICT. Miscaptioned. An image of a damaged railway bridge collapsed into a body of water was not taken in 2022 during the Russia-Ukraine war.

metatags.twitter:creator: @Reuters
metatags.og:description: An image of a damaged bridge was not taken in Kursk, Russia in May 2022 during the Russia-Ukraine war. A reverse image search shows that the image of the collapsed bridge into a body of water dates to June 2020 when it was published by Murmansk emergency services.

metatags.twitter:title: Massive blast cripples parts of Crimea-Russia bridge, in blow to Putin's war effort | CNN
metatags.author: Hannah Ritchie,Tim Lister,Josh Pennington
metatags.og:title: Massive blast cripples parts of Crimea-Russia bridge, in blow to Putin's war effort | CNN
metatags.og:description: In a major blow for Russian President Vladimir Putin, a huge explosion early Saturday severely damaged the only bridge connecting the annexed Crimean Peninsula with the Russian mainland, crimping a key supply route for Moscow’s faltering war in Ukraine.
